Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Andy, Angela, Phyllis, Ryan, Kelly, and Oscar are gathered around Oscar's computer lauging at a video of Cookie Monster]

Quote.Speaker: Cookie Monster
Quote.Text: [Kevin's voice] Oscar, Toby said he left my Girl Scout cookies on my chair. Have you seen them? Wait I'm sitting on them. [all laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you. It didn't even take that long.

Quote.Speaker: Cookie Monster
Quote.Text: [Kevin's voice] What's the difference between a chimichanga, [Kevin arrives behind the group] a chalupa, and a tostada? Call me back ASAP. It's urgent.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: This isn't funny. I don't talk like that. [all continue laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Say "Me eat cookie."

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No. I won't say it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why is everyone clumped around accounting? Break it up, you clique.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's Kevin as Cookie monster from Sesame Street.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [gets up and starts to walk to Oscar's desk] Is that the program where all those puppets live in the barrio?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I love that show.

Quote.Speaker: Cookie Monster
Quote.Text: [Kevin's voice] This is Kevin. This is Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Good work, buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is an amusing link. I'd like it sent to me, please.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Me, too Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: C.C. me

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Angela, this is inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is my favorite day.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's Secretary's Day. And it is Erin's and my three-week anniversary. So perfect storm for a romantic gesture. [Andy unfurling a giant "Happy Secretary's Day" banner by reception, placing a teddy bear on Erin's chair]. Want to make sure the whole office remembers it's Secretary's Day. I sent an e-mail blast, a text blast, a good, old-fashioned talk blast. I sent a snail mail blast a week ago. And a Stern reminder via fax at 7:00 this morning, so people better step up and appreciate the crap out of Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [hands Erin a basket of beets]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If it wasn't for secretaries, I wouldn't have a stepmom.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [as Halperts arrive] Welcome back!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's my first day back after maternity leave. And I miss Cece, of course. But we need the money. What was maternity leave like? Oh, how do I explain it?... It rocked. It rocked my ass off.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [at her desk, grabs her plant and sees it dried up, looks at Jim] Oh. You couldn't have watered it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I literally did not know that existed until this moment.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I knew it existed, and I chose to let it die.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's nice to see you again, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight.
Quote.Text: Hello, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [arrives at Michael's office and sits] I was just wondering what you had planned for Secretary's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to give Erin $15.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I know that Erin would be so psyched if you took her out to lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A one-on-one lunch with Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. She really looks up to you. And there's only so much we can do as her coworkers. Secretary's Day is really kind of a boss-secretary thing. [Michael glances over at Erin in reception, Erin waves her teddy bear's arm at Michael].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's kind of a rube.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [slams his hand on Michael's desk] That's my girlfriend you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. All right. All right. Okay. I'll take her to lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [taping desk] She's gonna be so psyched.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks over to Erin's desk] Hi, Erin. Happy Secretary's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, happy Boss's day. There wouldn't be a secretary if there was no boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wanted to know what your plans for lunch were because I was hoping to ask you to...[Erin snaps a picture of Michael] lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I got a picture of you asking me to lunch. I was thinking we could go to Hayworth's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Just the two of us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Hayworth's is more business casual, and they always screw up your order. So I'm...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, okay. Yeah that was a stupid suggestion. I was thinking someplace special, so I though Hayworth's, but...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, we'll figure something. [Michael turns and starts back toward his office]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looks at Andy who is urging he agree with her, Michael turns around] Okay, let's go to Hayworth's.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [cheerfully] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [sitting at kitchen table with Darryl] Have a cookie, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, haha. Tray of cookies. I'm not falling for that.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I brought those in. It's my birthday. That's some stone-cold narcissism right there.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Man, Darryl, I'm sorry. [pats Darryl's back] Happy Birthday.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thank you. [Kevin grabs cookie and starts eating it]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [as Cookie Monster] Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: They're making fun of Cookie Monster. I get that. But in a strange way, it feels like they're making fun of me.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [again on laptop as Cookie Monster as he shows Gabe the video] Oscar, did you eat some of my M&M's? The level...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: This is violent and offensive.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you. [computer continues] It really makes me self-conscious about my voice.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: It's awful. [reaches for tissue box, hands it to Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm not crying.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You have some food on your face.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [on computer as Cookie Monster] Do my hands feel sweaty to you? [Kevin grabs a tissue and wipes his mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: The beginning here has been a little bit of a fiasco. Either they don't respect me or they respect me too much. And some of them still think that I'm the I.T. guy. This Cookie Monster thing is an opportunity to show people that I'm an authority figure.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hello, everyone. If I might have a moment of your time. It's come to my attention that people have been watching and laughing at a hurtful parody video. It is now forbidden to talk, joke about, or e-mail this around.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: And that's straight from corporate. So not to be scary, but yeah, I would listen to me. And that's all. Ciao.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in his car with Erin driving to lunch] Would you mind if I listen to my book on tape? I'm kind of a bookworm. This is the novelization of the movie Precious based on the book Push by Sapphire.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I was thinking it would be fun to talk on the way over. So what decade would you have chosen to be a teenager?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [shakes head, annoyed] I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I would have chosen the 1490's.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahhh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: 'Cause America was discovered.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [at lunch] And then my last job was at a Taco Bell express. But then it became a full Taco Bell, and I don't know, I couldn't keep up. My favorite part about being a receptionist is that I get to have my own desk. In my Foster home I never had a desk. [Michael keeps moving around, very clearly bored and annoyed]. So it's like... I don't mean that I didn't like my foster home. I did like it. I just didn't have a desk there. Did you have a favorite age? Or month?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: An age or month?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, like a favorite month. Like I like April when I was seven.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've been trying. I've been trying to keep it going. Erin is just weird.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How many pillows do you sleep on at night?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So how are things going with Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's the best boyfriend in the world. Tell me about him before I met him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, let's see. Um... Andy. Plays the banjo.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah I love that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Other than the fact that he dated Angela, I don't think he is a snappy dresser.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't think he is the best dresser. Reminds me of Easter.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry. About Angela? Did you say he dated Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. You didn't know that? Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Hayworth's waiter
Quote.Text: Here we go. Hot plate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Hayworth's waiter
Quote.Text: And your salad, miss.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Why wouldn't he tell me that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. Probably didn't want you to have a mental image of him having sex with somebody else.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: They had sex?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They were engaged, so... [Erin looks shocked] Okay, you know what, sir?

Quote.Speaker: Hayworth's waiter
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I asked for pickles with my burger. And there are only, like five or six. Could I get some more pickles?

Quote.Speaker: Hayworth's waiter
Quote.Text: Of course. I'll get you a bowl of pickles.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uhhhh, they were engaged?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [face looks disgusted, moves around uncomfortably] Uh-oh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [moans, pulls hair over her face]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing? What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: In the Foster home, my hair was my room. [exhales, prolonged exclaiming]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. You know what? You know what? You know what? Everybody's looking at you right now.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [breathes heavily, groans]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [turns to other restaurant patrons] I'll have what she's having!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in Michael's car] Did you have a... did you like your lunch? Did you have a good lunch? Did you like that? Did you enjoy your food? It was good. I liked my lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [feels a pain in her breast] Ooh. Ah-ah-ah. Ha-ha.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Her milk is coming in. She's getting uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, don't be gross.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, he's right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Same thing happens with my cows if I don't tend them frequently enough. You gotta milk them, or else they'll moo like crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's weird, my breast pump is missing. Have you seen my breast pump?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [removes jacket, applies hand sanitizer] All right, this is gonna traumatize me a hell of a lot more than you, believe me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what, Dwight? Let me just check the bathroom first. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? Fine. Let your breasts explode. Three squeezes and I would drain you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm. [walks into bathroom, Meredith is using her brest pump] Meredith!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I just like the way it feels.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you doing?!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Just relax. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Relax?!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: This is like the Cadillac of pumps.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Give it back to me now.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Okay, I was just warming it up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's disgusting!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It's not a big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's not sterile!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: We're both girls. Who cares?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So... how was lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Lunch was fine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Was it everything that you hoped and dreamed it might be?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know. It was lunch, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I know. [stammers] Just want... I mean... [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Erin? I think we're out of fax cover sheets.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: God, Oscar, will you keep your pants on? It's easy.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [using a Cookie Monster voice] "My name is Kevin, I'm an accountant." See I did the voice.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's a little derivative.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But parody is always derivative.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, it's not organic. Do you know what I mean?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim does a really good one. Do yours.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, guys. I really refuse to participate. "Michael, can I have an advance on my paycheck because a Mrs. Fields Cookie just opened up at the mall."

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Guys, why don't we leave the parodies to the pros at Mad TV?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "Sorry, Gabe, but that show hasn't been on in many cookies."

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. Can I have your attention please? First of all, thanks to everyone for helping put this awesome party together. And a very special shout-out to the chair of the Party Planning Committee, miss Angela Martin. You have outdone yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, I think we can all agree that Angela's not so great, so..

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am saying the exact opposite. Angela is fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Specific shout-out..

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop talking.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok. As some of you may know, I have a very special connection with Secretary's Day in the form of that 115 pound moonbeam over there named Erin Hannon. To a lot of you she may just be the person who brings you your fax comformations. But to me, she is my girlfriend... in addition to being the person who brings me my fax comformations. So I wrote [starts to use a British accent] a little ditty. That I would like to play for all of you right now. It's a little tune called Secretary of Love. A one, a two, a one, two, three..

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [throws a piece of cake at Andy's face] I know about Angela! I know that you were engaged to her and that you were sleeping with her! Michael told me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can we talk about this in private?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't want to be in private. Is it true or is it not?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who else did you sleep with? Did you sleep with Phyllis or Kelly or Pam? Maybe all together?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no never.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Did everyone know? Was I the only one who didn't know?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah pretty much.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who are you?! I don't know you! [pushes someone away to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I should probably get involved in this, but I think my energy is better spent on the Cookie Monster issue.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Erin, you know, if I had been engaged to anyone before you, I would've told you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So if you need anything, I'm right over there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [imitating Cookie Monster] "Hey, Erin, You look delicious. I mean, beautiful."

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ok. Ok there. I heard that. So I'm sorry, Pam, but that's it. I'm going to have to suspend you without pay for two days.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? What do you mean, suspend me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you need to go a little easy. You can't just suspend someone form work.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah, you're right. You know what? Um, you're suspended too Jim. [Dwight starts to clap] Ok fine. You too Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, What? I was just slow-clapping your no-nonsense decision-making.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I don't want to hear it. Suspended.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: "C" is for suspension.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why would that be something to talk about on Secretary's Day?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andy, she's not the easiest person in the world to have a conversation with. All right? And besides, who doesn't tell their girlfriend that they were engaged to someone who works four feet away from them? That's like.. that's like Mr. and Mrs. Smith crap.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was going to tell her, just on my own time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, I resent the implication that I would keep that secret. Everyone here knows that I can't and won't keep a secret.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who cares? I mean it's not like I killed someone. Big deal right? This can blow over in two seconds. She never asked me. So, if you think about it... I probably should have told her I guess. Everybody does stupid things.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Psst. Hey. Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You want to talk to me, come to my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You embarrassed me earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. Take it up with the chief of police.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You think I want people remembering I had sensual relations with Andy? It's the kind of thing you wish you could have annulled. I want to throw up just thinking about it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I want to throw up just thinking about it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You are throwing up for the wrong reasons!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [standing behind Erin] I don't think this fax is going through. Is there a different... I can just put it through again, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. You know I was engaged before Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. And he worked here too.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It was Andy, wasn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no it wasn't Andy. It wasn't. It doesn't matter. It's not about who you've been with. It's about who you end up with. Sometimes the heart doesn't know what it wants until it finds what it wants.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I hope you find what you're looking for.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. [kisses Jim on the cheek]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [talking on the phone] So I can reprimand them but I can't suspend them. Oh I can't do either. Uh huh. Fair enough.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [answers phone] Hey Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I called Tallahassee. He can ask you not to come in, but he can't dock your pay. That's not legal.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Very interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I also learned some interesting things about how they structure...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Gabe walks in] Thanks Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey everyone. Hi. Quite an afternoon, huh? Cathartic in a way. I'm glad I got to share it with you. It makes you think about what's really important. [Pam hands Jim a note] It's not about showing you're in charge or flexing some sort of authority. It's about forgiveness. And yes, I'm talking about you three in this desk clump right here. I think that, if you were to apologize to me, then I would revoke your suspension.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think an apology is enough. I really think the only way for me to learn my lesson is to take my suspension.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I got to take this bad attitude, and I got to go home, and I got to adjust it. And I hope the suspension does that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [gets up and walks towards Gabe] Prideful idiots. Watch how it's done. [Jim and Pam get their things together and start to leave] Gabriel, I apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [gets on one knee] I kneel before you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Guys, I would even take a contrite look as an apology.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Humbly taking your hand upon which I kiss to show my contrition.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [following Jim and Pam to their car] Guys, to err is human. [trying to block their car]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Trust is the most important thing to me. Is your name Andy Bernard? What's your real name? Lionel Frankenstein?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Will you stop walking for one second? That's it. There's no other secrets. Ok? I mean yeah, my chest is not naturally hairless, and my parents pay my credit card bill.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How long were you guys together?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A year.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A year? You were together for a year?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah but that's it. Now you know everything about me. I promise. And if I think of anything else...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I think I have to be on my own for a little bit. Like the girl Precious in Precious. Based on the novel Push by Sapphire. Ok?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't see that movie.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [walking back into the office] That was ugly. I'm sorry you had to see that.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Do they still get paid?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: It's tacky to discuss finances. It's best to pretend that this never happened.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Sounds like they just got to go home with pay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Pathetic.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Can I buy everyone coffees? [everyone shakes their heads] [in Cookie Monster voice] "Or cookies."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What was that? Are you kidding me? Was that an impression?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [imitating Gabe] Uh guys, I'm now going to apologize for the mess that we're in because corporate told me to. I just want you to know that I laugh like a crazy person.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You got to be able to laugh at yourself. I'm one of the gang.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "I have to go back to the zoo to the stick insect exhibit."

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: "Ciao" Right? "Ciao. I say Ciao because I'm fancy from Tallahassee."

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Why don't we say ciao to the impressions? [everyone says ciao]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [sitting on bench outside groaning]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh. Sorry I thought everyone was gone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, I was just watching Cookie Monster. It finally downloaded. Mind if I sit down?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I can't trust Andy anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Yep. I'm sorry about that. I feel... I'm sorry I caused that thing.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's Andy's fault.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yeah, yes. But I still feel sorry. You know what, I wouldn't worry about Angela. She doesn't hold a candle to you, Erin. She's old enough to be your mom for one thing. And she's, like, three feet tall. And she wears pioneer women clothing. And I don't think she's ever pooped in her life. And Andy, you know, come on. Andy, his butt looks big in those khakis.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, I like his butt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You said butt.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You tricked me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh! You said it! You know who you would love? Oh, this guy in my neighborhood, Tom Dizemore. This is him:

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sometimes telling someone something is hard. Well, at least someone made her happy on Secretary's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar's voice from the computer
Quote.Text: Hey Kevin it's Oscar. I'm looking at the sheet you sent me. And I can't seem to find the column for shipping cost.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I made the most brilliant retaliation video. It's awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean, the Count has a very distinct voice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. "I vant to count to ten".

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But Oscar is an accountant, and the Count counts numbers.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But you're an accountant too.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why didn't you do Oscar the Grouch?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That would have been funny.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But the Count is purple and Oscar wears purple.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walking up] Oh, oh, I was just watching that. Did you do that, man? "Oscar. I am the Count." Nailed him. Nailed him. [Gives Kevin a fist pump] Good work Cookie Monster.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you.
